@graph.name: The Best Clam Chowder - Tastes Better from Scratch
@graph.description: Thick and creamy Clam Chowder is one of my favorite easy soup recipes, and this one has all the traditional elements we love.

@graph.name: Lauren Allen
@graph.description: Welcome! I’m Lauren, a mom of four and lover of good food. Here you’ll find easy recipes and weeknight meal ideas made with real ingredients, with step-by-step photos and videos.

@graph.name: Clam Chowder
@graph.description: Thick and creamy Clam Chowder is one of my favorite easy soup recipes, and this one has all the traditional elements we love, like diced potatoes, veggies and plenty of delicious clams.

video.name: Clam Chowder
video.description: This DELICIOUS Clam Chowder with potatoes and vegetables is one of my favorite easy soup recipes to make during the cooler months. The clam chowder broth is thick and creamy like a Boston or New England clam chowder and it tastes like it came from a restaurant!

recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 pounds russet potatoes (, peeled and diced (about 3 medium potatoes))

recipeInstructions.text: Drain the clams, adding the juice from the cans to a large stock pot. Set the clams aside.
recipeInstructions.name: Drain the clams, adding the juice from the cans to a large stock pot. Set the clams aside.

recipeInstructions.text: Add chicken broth and diced potatoes to the pot (the liquid should just barely cover the potatoes). Bring to a simmer, add the bay leaf, and cook until the potatoes are barely fork tender, about 5-6 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Add chicken broth and diced potatoes to the pot (the liquid should just barely cover the potatoes). Bring to a simmer, add the bay leaf, and cook until the potatoes are barely fork tender, about 5-6 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: While the potatoes cook, in a second pot, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat until the butter is melted. Add the onions, celery, bell peppers and garlic and cook until tender, about 4-5 minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: While the potatoes cook, in a second pot, heat the butter and olive oil over medium heat until the butter is melted. Add the onions, celery, bell peppers and garlic and cook until tender, about 4-5 minutes.

recipeInstructions.text: Stir in the flour and cook for 30 seconds. Gradually stir in the milk and half and half, whisking as you add them to break up any clumps of flour. Bring mixture to a simmer and cook until the thickened, about 5 minutes
recipeInstructions.name: Stir in the flour and cook for 30 seconds. Gradually stir in the milk and half and half, whisking as you add them to break up any clumps of flour. Bring mixture to a simmer and cook until the thickened, about 5 minutes

recipeInstructions.text: Stir the creamy mixture into the potatoes. Stir in the salt, pepper, vinegar, and reserved clams. Cook for 5 more minutes.
recipeInstructions.name: Stir the creamy mixture into the potatoes. Stir in the salt, pepper, vinegar, and reserved clams. Cook for 5 more minutes.
